docblock.description: Generates an internal or external HTML hypertext link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Defines a URL to open when this element is clicked

tag.name: param
tag.description: Content enclosed between the tags of the generated link (i.e., content)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets the title of the generated hypertext link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets a target (where to open linked document) or (either) an id or a class attribute for styling

tag.description: The generated hypertext link

tag.description: Content to be wrapped inside the generated HTML divider

docblock.description: [favicon description]
Generates a link element that specifies the relationship(s) between the current document and an external resource

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies the URL of the linked resource; URL can be absolute or relative

tag.name: param
tag.description: Names a relationship of the linked document to the current document

tag.name: param
tag.description: Defines the media-type of the linked content; this value must be a media query

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyper-link

tag.name: return
tag.description: A generated link tag parsed by using the passed parameters values

tag.description: add attributes: hreflang, media, crossorigin (5), sizes (5) and write error handling

docblock.description: Generates a mailto hypertext link to mail content to a single (or several) an email address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Recipient's e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Carbon copy e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Blind carbon copy e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Subject corresponding to the e-mail(s) prepped for this link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Body (or content) for the e-mail(s) being prepped for this link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Content enclosed between the tags of this generated link

tag.name: return
tag.description: Generated mailto link

docblock.description: Generates a Meta tag that provides metadata about the HTML document generated and served

tag.name: param
tag.description: They key set here is either a 'http-equiv' header for the info/value pair or a 'name' part of the name/value pair.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content which gives the value associated with the 'http-equiv' or 'name' attribute.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Generated <meta> tag.

docblock.description: Generates an internal <script> tag to define client-side script; such as JavaScript

tag.name: param
tag.description: The source of the file, module, or program to load

tag.name: param
tag.description: The media type for the generated script

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets whether the script is meant to be executed after the documented as been parsed

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets the character encoding of an external script; For external scripts "only"!

tag.name: return
tag.description: A generated script tag parsed by using the passed parameters values

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add attributes: Integrity, Async [HTML5], and Crossorigin

docblock.description: Generic tag method that generates generic HTML tags passed via it's secondary parameter through using the content and tag data passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content that will be wrapped in the generated tag

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag to be used while generated the generic HTML content

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a concatenated (single) string resulting in a generated meta tag with the passed content enclosed inside

docblock.description: Template Engine
docblock.long-description: Templating engine that generates HTML files utilizing WAFFLE's view's, or ".wad" files

docblock.description: Template filename to load, and eventually parse via this template engine
The value of each template tag (e.g., [!tag]) authored throughout each template file (e.g., *.wad)
Object to contain the File class, which parses, writes, and modifies files contents or returns a file's contents once read from source
Constructor method used to instantiate a new Template object after passing its associate file.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The filename of the template file to load

docblock.description: Sets the value to replace the specific tag passed through this function.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The key used to identify the template tag (e.g., [!temp_tag]) to be set

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value parsed (or supplemented); in correspondence with its key

docblock.description: Output a correctly formatted HTML (String), after supplementing each template tag identified through each assigned view (*.wad) file.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $output Correctly formatted HTML.

docblock.description: Merge multiple templates together to output each template view passed as a single string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An array of templates to be merged.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Format each template merged with this separator.

tag.name: return
tag.description: $output Output all of the merged (or concatenated) content with the separator passed through.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets a descriptor; target, id, or a class attribute utilizing the name passed

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a generic HTML divider, or <div> tag, wrapped around the '$content' passed via this method's param

docblock.description: [favicon description]
Generates a link element that specifies the relationship(s) between the current document and an external resource

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies the URL of the linked resource; URL can be absolute or relative

tag.name: param
tag.description: Names a relationship of the linked document to the current document

tag.name: param
tag.description: Defines the media-type of the linked content; this value must be a media query

tag.name: param
tag.description: Specifies that the target will be downloaded when a user clicks on the hyper-link

tag.name: return
tag.description: A generated link tag parsed by using the passed parameters values

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add attributes: hreflang, media, crossorigin (5), sizes (5) and write error handling

docblock.description: Generates a mailto hypertext link to mail content to a single (or several) an email address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Recipient's e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Carbon copy e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Blind carbon copy e-mail address(es)

tag.name: param
tag.description: Subject corresponding to the e-mail(s) prepped for this link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Body (or content) for the e-mail(s) being prepped for this link

tag.name: param
tag.description: Content enclosed between the tags of this generated link

tag.name: return
tag.description: Generated mailto link

docblock.description: Generates a Meta tag that provides metadata about the HTML document generated and served

tag.name: param
tag.description: They key set here is either a 'http-equiv' header for the info/value pair or a 'name' part of the name/value pair.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content which gives the value associated with the 'http-equiv' or 'name' attribute.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Generated <meta> tag.

docblock.description: Generates an internal <script> tag to define client-side script; such as JavaScript

tag.name: param
tag.description: The source of the file, module, or program to load

tag.name: param
tag.description: The media type for the generated script

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets whether the script is meant to be executed after the documented as been parsed

tag.name: param
tag.description: Sets the character encoding of an external script; For external scripts "only"!

tag.name: return
tag.description: A generated script tag parsed by using the passed parameters values

tag.name: todo
tag.description: add attributes: Integrity, Async [HTML5], and Crossorigin

docblock.description: Generic tag method that generates generic HTML tags passed via it's secondary parameter through using the content and tag data passed

tag.name: param
tag.description: The content that will be wrapped in the generated tag

tag.name: param
tag.description: The tag to be used while generated the generic HTML content

tag.name: return
tag.description: Returns a concatenated (single) string resulting in a generated meta tag with the passed content enclosed inside

markers.todo: Develop file-version logic for method, so that developers can pass a simple filename in accompaniment with the version that they are attempting to set

parse_markers.error: Only one @package tag is allowed
